member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Interop.AvalonBitmapInterop.RenderGdipIntoAvalonImage(System.Windows.Size,JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Interop.AvalonBitmapInterop.AlphaChannel,System.Action{System.Drawing.Graphics})
member.summary: Creates a GDI+ Graphics to render into, and returns the rendering result in a form of an Avalon image.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Interop.AvalonBitmapInterop.RenderGdipIntoAvalonImage_GdiBitmap_DIBitmap(System.Windows.Size,JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Interop.AvalonBitmapInterop.AlphaChannel,System.Action{System.Drawing.Graphics})
member.summary: Creates a GDI+ Graphics to render into, and returns the rendering result in a form of an Avalon image.
member.remarks: Thought it could re-use the bits of , but seems like it's not the way it works.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Interop.AvalonBitmapInterop.RenderGdipIntoAvalonImage_GdipBitmap(System.Windows.Size,JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Interop.AvalonBitmapInterop.AlphaChannel,System.Action{System.Drawing.Graphics})
member.summary: Creates a GDI+ Graphics to render into, and returns the rendering result in a form of an Avalon image.
member.remarks: Creates a byte buffer, a GDI+ bitmap right on these bytes, and then an Avalon image off these bytes. Could be easily turned into a to reuse its bytes on subsequent renders of the same size, but in this method if a GDI DC is created off the GDIP DC, then any transparency functions would fail (cannot get the back color it seems), like ClearType or even rectangles with alpha. So we cannot use it as a main method, and thus no use optimizing into a .

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Interop.AvalonBitmapInterop.RenderGdipIntoAvalonImage_GdiBitmap_DIBSection(System.Windows.Size,JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Interop.AvalonBitmapInterop.AlphaChannel,System.Action{System.Drawing.Graphics})
member.summary: Creates a GDI+ Graphics to render into, and returns the rendering result in a form of an Avalon image.
member.remarks: Creates a GDI bitmap, HDC on it, Graphics on that, and uses the GDI bitmap bytes to create an Avalon image off those. Not quite compatible with because the bits are created by anew each time.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.AvalonEx.MakeGeometryBrush(System.Windows.Media.Geometry,System.Windows.Media.SolidColorBrush,System.Windows.Media.Pen)
member.summary: For a geometry, creates a brush that could be used to paint a rectangle with a geometry. The geometry spans the whole brush area. The coordinate space of the geometry is assumed to be (0,0)-(1000,1000). It would have been better to have (0,0)-(1,1), but some of the Avalon geometry clippers revert to rough edges on sizes less than one.
member.param: The Geometry.
Brush. Optional.
Pen (brush + thinkness). Optional.
member.returns: The brush that paints the geometry.

member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

summary.para: Initializes the component. Called by the component container after the component is created.
is the pairing method that's guaranteed to be called by the component container to tear down your component.
You must not access other components before your method is called.
All of the components that you access from are guaranteed to exist when your is called. Any other component might be missing by that time, and trying to get it will throw an exception.

member.name: T:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim
member.summary: Applies a list of s to an Avalon .

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.OptionDevTenBeta2PlantIntoStatusDockPanel
member.summary: In DevTen Beta2, the status bar itself lives on another thread, which makes it planting our controls very complicated because of the threading issues. That's why we prefer planting to the dock panel that hosts the status bar.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.AvalonStatusBar
member.summary: When non-Null, means the status bar we should be attached to. Note: this is used along the code path when we have the status bar hosted on the UI thread (VS10 beta 1). In VS 10 Beta 2, another approach is used. This code remains for possible other shells.

member.name: F:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.StatusDockPanel
member.summary: When non-Null, means the on the bottom of the window, to which our status indicators should be added in a dock-right fashion. Usually the status bar itself sits in the same dock panel. This approach is used when we cannot deal with the status bar itself to put the items into it properly. The case in VS 10 beta 2, where the status bar control itself sits on another thread and causes a marshalling pain for us if operated directly. It's expected to be a really, but we'd fallback for cases when we find ourselves in an unexpected layout and look for just any suitable panel.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusBarInHwnd(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Tries to find an Avalon status bar in the given window. The window must be fully inited by the moment.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusDockPanelInHwnd(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Tries to detect the status line of the window

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.AddItemsHostToStatusBar(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl)
member.summary: Helper for attaching to a status bar. Places a panel for our items in among its indicators. Must be executed on the status bar thread.
member.param: The status bar to plant into.
The Avalon element to put on the status bar as its item.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.AddItemsHostToStatusDockPanel(System.Windows.Controls.Panel,System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl)
member.summary: Helper for attaching to the status line of a window. Places a panel for our items in between the status bar and resize grip. Must be executed on the UI thread.
member.param: The dock panel of the window status line.
The Avalon element to put on the status bar as its item.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusBarInHwnd_UiThread(System.Windows.PresentationSource)
member.summary: Take 1: find all explicit status bars in the application window. Workable on VS10 up to Beta2 (non-inclusive).

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.Controls.AvalonStatusBarShim.TryFindStatusBarInHwnd_WorkerThread(System.Windows.PresentationSource)
member.summary: Take 2: in VS 10 beta 2, the status bar is hosted in another thread. There seems to be no legal way for ripping out the nested object graph. Do some hacks.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.MultiValueConverter.System#Windows#Data#IMultiValueConverter#Convert(System.Object[],System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts source values to a value for the binding target. The data binding engine calls this method when it propagates the values from source bindings to the binding target.
member.returns: A converted value.If the method returns null, the valid null value is used.A return value of . indicates that the converter did not produce a value, and that the binding will use the if it is available, or else will use the default value.A return value of . indicates that the binding does not transfer the value or use the or the default value.
member.param: The array of values that the source bindings in the produces. The value indicates that the source binding has no value to provide for conversion.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.MultiValueConverter.System#Windows#Data#IMultiValueConverter#ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type[],System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a binding target value to the source binding values.
member.returns: An array of values that have been converted from the target value back to the source values.
member.param: The value that the binding target produces.
The array of types to convert to. The array length indicates the number and types of values that are suggested for the method to return.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.

member.param: A that reflects the available size that this window can give to the child. Infinity can be given as a value to indicate that the window will size to whatever content is available.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.PopupWindowManager.TrackedWindow.IsGlassified
member.summary: A readonly property that gets whether the glass effect is actually applied to the window at the moment. The property is just an intention that may be unsupported by the runtime.

member.summary: Gets context the window is shown in. May be Null.

member.summary: Gets whether the window has already been disposed.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.PopupWindowManager.TrackedWindow.LayoutMode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the popup window location and size is currently controlled by the layouter.

member.name: P:JetBrains.UI.PopupWindowManager.TrackedWindow.Mutex
member.summary: Gets the mutex that defines the popup window's identity class. For example, it may prohibit displaying more than one window of the same class at a time. This value should be immutable.

member.name: M:JetBrains.UI.Avalon.ValueConverter`2.Convert(System.Object,System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts a value. The data binding engine calls this method when it propagates a value from the binding source to the binding target.
member.returns: A converted value.If the method returns null, the valid null value is used.A return value of . indicates that the converter produced no value and that the binding uses the , if available, or the default value instead.A return value of . indicates that the binding does not transfer the value or use the or default value.
member.param: The culture to use in the converter.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use.
The value produced by the binding source.

member.summary: Converts a value. The data binding engine calls this method when it propagates a value from the binding target to the binding source.
member.returns: A converted value.If the method returns null, the valid null value is used.A return value of . indicates that the converter produced no value and that to the binding uses the , if available, or the default value instead.A return value of . indicates that the binding does not transfer the value or use the or default value.
member.param: The culture to use in the converter.
The type to convert to.
The converter parameter to use.
The value that is produced by the binding target.
